elements.name: TeacherYears
elements.title: Counting this school year, how many years have you been a schoolteacher? (please round up to the nearest half year)

elements.name: TeacherOtherAdult
elements.title: Is there another adult who is paid to help you in your classroom (e.g., teaching assistant, co-lead teacher, etc.)?

elements.name: TeacherStudentsEnroll
elements.title: How many students are enrolled in your classroom?

elements.name: TeacherStudentsGender
elements.title: How many children of each gender are in your class?

elements.title: As of today's date, how many children in your class are each of the following age levels?

elements.name: TeacherMultigrade
elements.title: Do you currently teach a multigrade class?

elements.name: TeacherMultigradeLevels
elements.title: If yes, what grade levels are included in the class you teach?

elements.name: TeacherLanguageStudents
elements.title: What languages are spoken by students in your class (please list)?

elements.name: TeacherLanguageTeachers
elements.title: What languages do you or your assistant teacher speak in the classroom (please list)?

elements.title: How many children in your classroom are below grade level in their reading skills?

elements.title: How many children in your classroom are above grade level in their reading skills?

elements.title: How many children in your classroom are below grade level in their math skills?

elements.name: TeacherMathAbove
elements.title: How many children in your classroom are above grade level in their math skills?

elements.name: TeacherReadingFrequency
elements.title: How often do children in your class usually work on lessons or projects in Reading and Language Arts, whether as a whole class, in small groups, or in individualized arrangements?

elements.name: TeacherReadingTime
elements.title: How much time do children in your class usually work on lessons or projects in Reading and Language Arts, whether as a whole class, in small groups, or in individualized arrangements?

elements.name: TeacherMathFrequency
elements.title: How often do children in your class usually work on lessons or projects in Mathematics, whether as a whole class, in small groups, or in individualized arrangements?

elements.name: TeacherMathTime
elements.title: How much time do children in your class usually work on lessons or projects in Mathematics, whether as a whole class, in small groups, or in individualized arrangements?

elements.name: TeacherClimateItems
elements.title: Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with the following statements about this school.

rows.text: I feel accepted and respected as a colleague by most staff members.
Parents are supportive of school staff.
This school is a supportive and inviting place for students to learn.
This school is a supportive and inviting place for staff to work.
This school is a safe place for students.
This school is a safe place for staff.
This school has clean and well-maintained facilities and property.
Adults who work at this school are collaborating regularly.
Adults who work at this school have close professional relationships with one another.
Adults who work at this school support and treat each other with respect.

elements.name: TeacherFeelJobItems
elements.title: With this set of items, we wish to learn more about teachers' feelings about their job. Please select one answer that indicates how strongly you agree with each of the following statements.

columns.text: A few times a year or less

rows.text: I feel emotionally drained from my work.
I feel fatigued when I get up in the morning and have to face another day on the job.
I can easily understand how my students feel about things.
I deal very effectively with the problems of my students.
I feel burned out from my work.
I feel I'm positively influencing other people's lives through my work.
I feel frustrated by my job.
I feel I'm working too hard on my job.
I can easily create a relaxed atmosphere with my students.
I feel exhilarated after working closely with my students.
I have accomplished many worthwhile things in this job.
I feel like I'm at the end of my rope.
In my work, I deal with emotional problems very calmly.

elements.name: TeacherBeliefTeachItems
elements.title: This set of questions is designed to help us gain a better understanding of the kinds of things that create difficulties for teachers in their school activities. Please select one answer that indicates your level of influence for each of the statements below.

rows.text: How much can you do to control disruptive behavior in the classroom?
How much can you do to motivate children who show low interest in activities?
How much can you do to get children to believe they can do well on activities?
How much can you do to help children in your classroom value learning?
To what extent can you craft good questions for children in your classroom?
How much can you do to get children to follow classroom rules?
How much can you do to calm a child who is disruptive or noisy?
How well can you establish a classroom management system with each group of children?
How much can you use a variety of assessment strategies?
To what extent can you provide an alternative explanation or example when children are confused?
How much can you assist families in helping their children do well in school?
How well can you implement alternative strategies in your classroom?

elements.name: TeacherIdeasChildrenItems
elements.title: With this set of items, we wish to learn more about teachers' ideas and beliefs about young children. Please select one answer that indicates how strongly you agree with each of the following statements.

rows.text: Since parents lack special training in education, they should not question the teacher's teaching methods.
Children should be treated the same regardless of differences among them.
Children should always obey the teacher.
Preparing for the future is more important for a child than enjoying today.
Children will not do the right thing unless they must.
Children should be allowed to disagree with their parents if they feel their own ideas are better.
Children should be kept busy with work and study at home and at school.
The major goal of education is to put basic information into the minds of the children.
In order to be fair, a teacher must treat all children alike.
The most important thing to teach children is absolute obedience to whoever is in authority.
Children learn best by doing things themselves rather than listening to others.
Children must be carefully trained early in life or their natural impulses will make them unmanageable.
Children have a right to their own point of view and should be allowed to express it.
Children's learning results mainly from being presented basic information again and again.
Children like to teach other children.
The most important thing to teach children is absolute obedience to parents.

elements.name: TeacherFamilySupport
TeacherFamilyOverwhelm
elements.title: Families seem overwhelmed by trying to support their children's learning.

elements.name: TeacherFamilyHelping
elements.title: Families are doing their part to support children's learning.
Think about the families of the children you have taught this school year. For about how many families are each of the following statements true?

elements.name: TeacherComm
TeacherCommFamily
elements.title: Communication between you and families.

elements.name: TeacherCommStudents
elements.title: Communication between you and your students.
Please indicate how satisfied or dissatisfied you have been with the following this school year.
